solution.text:
Diameter of the hemisphere, d\(=_{j}_\,cm\Rightarrow\)Radius of hemisphere, r\(=_{{j/Decimal(2)}}_\,cm\)
The amount of fluid displaced by a hemispherical solid is equal to its volume.
Volume of the hemisphere\(=\frac23 \pi r^3\)
\(=\frac23 \pi \times _{{j/Decimal(2)}}_^3\)
\(=_{{trunc(((2/Decimal(3))*pi_val*(j/Decimal(2))**3),3)}}_\,cm^3\)

content.text: The amount of fluid displaced by a hemispherical solid of diameter \(_{j}_\)cm.
